articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: US Judicial Actions Test Trump's Federal Overhaul Efforts
articles.description: US domestic news highlights include the U.S. Naval Academy ending racial factors in admission, SEC's collaboration with DOJ, multiple judicial blocks on Trump administration efforts regarding CBC, VOICE, deportations, and labor boards. A federal probe into LA's gun permits process also sparked controversy, alongside other Trump-related tales.
articles.content: In a significant policy shift, the U.S. Naval Academy has announced it will exclude racial factors from its admissions criteria, aligning with then-President Trump's stance on race-based admissions. This decision has sparked legal challenges and furt... [749 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Elon Musk's Crucial Role in Government Efficiency
articles.description: Billionaire Elon Musk, an adviser to President Trump, will meet with CIA's John Ratcliffe to discuss government efficiency. Amid federal workforce cuts, Musk oversees reductions alongside the Department of Government Efficiency. He recently visited the Department of Defense, countering reports on secret China war plans as propaganda.
articles.content: Elon Musk, the billionaire entrepreneur, acting as a top adviser to President Donald Trump, is set to visit the Central Intelligence Agency on Monday. The meeting, which involves discussions on government efficiency with CIA Director John Ratcliffe, ... [658 chars]

articles.author: CP24 Toronto
articles.title: Donald Trump, major U.S. law firm reach deal
articles.description: A prominent international law firm reached a deal with U.S. President Donald Trump on Friday to dedicate at least US$100 million in free legal services and to review its hiring practices, averting a punishing executive order like the ones directed at nearly a half-dozen other major legal institutions in recent weeks.
articles.content:
U.S. President Donald Trump speaks at an education event and executive order signing in the East Room of the White House in Washington, Thursday, March 20, 2025. (AP Photo/Jose Luis Magana)
WASHINGTON — WASHINGTON — A prominent international law firm... [5538 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Legal Battle Intensifies: Law Firms vs. Trump's Executive Orders
articles.description: A U.S. judge temporarily blocked parts of an executive order by Donald Trump targeting law firm Jenner & Block. WilmerHale and Jenner & Block have sued, claiming Trump's orders against them are unconstitutional. The orders allegedly retaliate against firms involved in probing Russian interference in the 2016 election.
articles.content: In a significant development, a U.S. District Judge in Washington has temporarily halted key elements of an executive order issued by former President Donald Trump that targeted the law firm Jenner & Block. This comes as another firm, Skadden Arps, r... [776 chars]

articles.author: The Indian Express
articles.title: Judge blocks Trump administration from firing staff of Voice of America
articles.description: Judge James Paul Oetken blocked the US Agency for Global Media, which runs Voice of America.
articles.content: A federal judge on Friday halted the Trump administration’s efforts to dismantle the Voice of America, the eight-decade-old US government-funded international news service, calling the move a “classic case of arbitrary and capricious decision making.... [260 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Israeli officials furious that Signal group chat exposed intelligence, sources say
articles.description: Sources tell CBS News the Signal chat involving senior Trump administration officials included sensitive intelligence Israel provided to the U.S.
articles.content: Washington — Israeli officials are furious over the Signal chat leak involving senior Trump administration officials because it included sensitive intelligence Israel provided to the U.S. from a human intelligence source in Yemen, CBS News has learne... [5660 chars]

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: Court Blocks Trump's Attempt to Dismantle CFPB
articles.description: A U.S. judge has blocked the Trump administration's efforts to shut down the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB), following lawsuits by a workers union and consumer advocates. The decision temporarily halts the administration's push for rapid reformation of federal structures under the guise of government efficiency.
articles.content: A U.S. judge halted the Trump administration's efforts to dismantle the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) on Friday, marking a significant legal rebuff. The decision, made by District Judge Amy Berman Jackson, came after lawsuits from a wor... [803 chars]

articles.title: US judge temporarily blocks Trump from firing Voice of America staff
articles.description: ‘Victory for press freedom’ after judge says rescinding funds for radio network requires congressional approval

articles.author: Devdiscourse
articles.title: US Naval Academy Revises Admissions Policy Amid Legal Pressure
articles.description: The US Naval Academy will stop considering race, ethnicity, or sex in its admissions process following an executive order by President Trump. This policy change aligns with the order's demand for a non-preferential military. The move comes after legal challenges and debates on national security and diversity.
articles.content: The US Naval Academy has announced it will no longer factor race, ethnicity, or sex into its admissions decisions, following an executive order from President Donald Trump. This shift in policy was formalized by Vice Admiral Yvette Davids, the academ... [722 chars]

articles.title: Carlos Watson Says Trump Has Commuted His Prison Sentence for Fraud
articles.description: Convicted fraudster Carlos Watson says President Trump has commuted his 10-year prison sentence connected to his digital media startup Ozy Media.
articles.content:
Carlos Watson and his supporters are asserting that President Donald Trump has commuted the nearly 10-year prison sentence that he received after being convicted of extensive fraud in operating his digital media startup Ozy Media.
